item.title: Making a Static Website
item.description: https://www.staticgen.com/ https://wsvincent.com/static-vs-dynamic-websites-pros-and-cons/ https://dzone.com/articles/6-reasons-why-you-should-go-for-a-static-website https://devopedia.org/package-manager Like many users, I started using R regularly to do statistical analysis. I never thought at the time I would be able to use Choosing a Static Website Generator Even though I have been using RStudio IDE regularly, I didn’t initially resort to the blogdown package but decided to test Jekyll out, which is the generator for pages that use the .github.io domain. There was really no preference for a particular generator for me since I was new to the process, but Jekyll seemed popular (this is likely because it came out earlier than most other static website generators) and has a compelling showcase.
